How to run the simulation?

 

  1. Install Labview Run-Time Engine (33 MB): available at file:\\cern.ch\dfs\users\s\sfranz\Public\PH-ATI-DC  or you can download it for windows NT/XP or for Mac OS X.
  2. Then run the simulation, all the fields you can change are white. When your configuration is set up, click on “Launch simulation”, you will find the voltages of the junction box and of each ELMB (16 nodes are displayed and you can go along the bus to see the others).

 

WARNING: Minimum screen resolution of 1024*768 required and really better with 1280*960 or 1280*1024 (45s loading time with the first and almost immediately for the two last).

1: Voltage at the junction box

2: Length of the thin cable between the junction box and the first node of the bus and its linear resistance… to be parameterized.

3: Current consumption of each node, by default the current consumption is set up at 20 mA for the first 32 nodes but you can set it up each consumption separately.

IMPORTANT: this is not the global current consumption which has to be set up but the one of the I/O controller (it takes more current than the CAN controller) because they are powered up separately.

            4: Display of the voltage at each node and a green/red button which indicate quickly if the ELMB concerned has the good power to make it work (i.e. between 7 and 16 volts).

            5: Length of the thin cable between each node, each value can be set up separately.

            6: Permits to navigate along the bus. It indicates the numbers of the first and the last node displayed, by default 1 to 16).

            7: A trend of the controller voltage versus nodes numbers.

            8: Length of the thick cable between the power supply and the junction box and its linear resistance… to be parameterized.

            9: Set up of the voltage of the power supply.

            10: Number of nodes on the bus… to be parameterized.

            11: Click on it to display the result of your simulation (you have to click on it again each time you change a parameter to refresh the panel).

            12: To stop the program.

            13: Tools for the graph.

.
